programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack Tripper finally meets his match when a devilish 12-year-old boy wins the girl's sympathy and moves into the apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley is jealous when Helen wants to reunite with an old boyfriend who is in town, so he tries to reconnect with an old girlfriend to get even with her. Also, David trades Jeffrey's model train set for Stanley's old inner tube.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen and her sisters are shocked by their elderly mother wanting to have a 'wake' for herself. She invites others to say goodbye in advance. Also, Jeffrey throws his back out and is trapped in a chair.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The Brookes are expecting a Congressman to drop by and Jeffrey doesn't want the Ropers around when he comes.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel's 42nd birthday yields an unexpected gift! She's pregnant.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Your Guest is as Good as Mine
programme.desc: Henry's free-spirited niece, April, comes to live with the Rushes while pursuing a songwriting career in as San Francisco.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Muriel wonder whether Sara is their real daughter when they learn that a hospital nurse switched babies around in the nursery when she was born.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Nick needs a job and Susan volunteers to hire him to work with her. Meanwhile Ben inadvertently calls Janey a prostitute as the two discuss her boyfriends.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan thinks she has become pregnant but when they realize it was a false alarm, Susan decides that the answer is surgery - on Ben!

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: A French exchange student causes havoc with the Harper men. Nick joins a science experiment. Michael must sleep in Nick's room with interesting results.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: When Susan finds that Janey doesn't trust her, she lets her have a teenage party alone while she is in Oxford with Ben.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard is worried about not being a big success when he decides to attend his class reunion. His rival Lester looks young plus he's wealthy with a gorgeous wife. Howard becomes angry with envy.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene reverts to a stuttering timid child when her father returns for a visit. Bannister decides to give them both advice.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Cobb's is taken over by a huge conglomerate that also owns a famous hotel chain, Bannister has visions of becoming the manager of a luxury resort.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene finds herself the object of a secret admirer who leaves her flowers and love notes. At the same time, Bannister starts giving advice to Derek, the young bag boy who might be in over his head.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister learns that the new owners have sent out a corporate spy to infiltrate Cobb's and warns the staff to be on guard. The result is an atmosphere of paranoia as everyone suspects each other of spying.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Bannister learns Cobb's is to be featured on an investigative news program, he gets excited at the thought of being seen on television coast-to-coast. The trouble happens when the show writer decides she doesn't want him to be seen.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: There is a new Cobb's store about to open and Christian and Edna have both been selected as potential managers. Bannister is convinced Edna doesn't have a chance so he secretly endorses Christian.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack lies to his visiting Aunt Mae to try to cover up his living arrangement with Vicky. Jack hires surfer E.Z. Taylor as his assistant at the restaurant.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After James falls for a young artist, Jack tries to save him from heartbreak.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After Jack saves James' life, James finds Jack to be the son he never had.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Vicky's former boyfriend opens a seafood restaurant across from Jack's Bistro and makes Jack jealous.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack seeks advice from a psychologist about his recent impotence. Vicky thinks Jack is cheating on her with E.Z.'s girlfriend Susie.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack is asked to identify a counterfeiter, Mr. Bradford appears in the police lineup.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky is pregnant, but it's E.Z.'s dog who is expecting.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack and Vicky are cast in a commercial for her airline, Jack fights with the temperamental director.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Both Stanley and Jeffrey argue with their wives and walk out on them at the same time. Getting drunk at a bar brings them together as buddies, but sobering up may open their eyes to a big problem they've unwittingly created.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A fire in the kitchen leads to the Ropers having to stay with the Brookes family until their place is ready again. However, Stanley's behavior gets on Jeffrey's last nerve.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen hires Stanley's friend, Joey, to haul out their furniture so she can redecorate. Her brother in law, Hubert, hears of Helen's plan and decides to buy some new furniture. Joey offers to sell his furniture for him and sells it to Stanley. When Helen sees he bought her sister's furniture she freaks out.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen really wants an electric organ but Stanley won't pay for one. Anne has an emergency and asks Helen to do her a favor by showing a buyer some property. An embarrassing situation may complicate things.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Jeffrey Brookes has a secret. His Uncle Bill is a free spirited "hobo" who has no interest in material things. To his horror, Bill shows up at his doorstep...but not before Stanley meets him and hires Bill to help around his place.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Running out of money, Stanley needs to take a job on the killing floor at his brother-in-law Hubert's meat packing plant. Later, his fortunes change when he learns Hubert is planning a secret trip to Acapulco with his secretary.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: When Stanley is being inattentive towards Helen, she decides to make him jealous by pretending to have an affair with the gardener. Both Anne and Jeffrey Brookes decide to help out and also hire some other guys to pose as Helen's lover.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.sub-title: And Who's Been Sleeping in My... ?
programme.desc: A young woman without a place to live has been sleeping in the Ropers' storage room. Stanley thinks the girl is a dangerous "dope fiend" while Helen wants to let her stay.

programme.desc: Jack lies to his visiting Aunt Mae to try to cover up his living arrangement with Vicky. Jack hires surfer E.Z. Taylor as his assistant at the restaurant.
